headline: GoPro names insider Brian Tratt as CFO
summary: Action camera maker GoPro on Thursday ‌named Brian Tratt ‌as its chief financial officer, taking ​over the baton from Brian McGee, effective March 17. The company said 66-year-old McGee, ‌who joined ⁠GoPro in 2015 after a tenure at semiconductor ⁠company Qualcomm, would become president and retain his ​chief operating ​officer ​role. Tratt, 42, will ‌step into the CFO post after serving as vice president of finance since August 2024.

headline: CNBC Daily Open: Private credit fears and U.S.-Iran tensions pressure Wall Street
summary: Meanwhile, Blue Owl Capital tightened investor liquidity after selling $1.4 billion in loan assets, raising alarms about stability in the private credit market.
